content:
I'd be happy to help you with healthy dinner ideas for the week. Since you've got lunch covered on Tuesdays and Thursdays, I'll provide you with dinner ideas for the remaining days. Here are some healthy options:

Monday:

* Grilled Chicken Breast with Roasted Vegetables: Marinate chicken breast in your favorite seasonings and grill it. Serve with a variety of roasted vegetables like broccoli, Brussels sprouts, and sweet potatoes.

Wednesday:

* Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Steamed Asparagus: Season salmon fillets with lemon and herbs, and bake in the oven until cooked through. Serve with quinoa and steamed asparagus.

Friday:

* Lentil Soup with Whole Grain Bread: Cook lentils with diced vegetables and spices, then season with your favorite herbs. Serve with a side of whole grain bread for dipping.

Saturday:

* Grilled Turkey Burgers with Avocado and Sweet Potato Fries: Grill turkey burgers and top with avocado, lettuce, and tomato. Serve with oven-baked sweet potato fries seasoned with herbs and spices.

Sunday:

* Chicken and Vegetable Stir-Fry with Brown Rice: Stir-fry diced chicken breast with your favorite vegetables (like bell peppers, carrots, and snow peas) in a small amount of oil. Serve with brown rice and a side of steamed green beans.

Feel free to swap out ingredients or interchange different protein sources to keep things interesting. Enjoy your meals, and I hope you and Rachel enjoy your salads on Tuesdays and Thursdays!
